title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic in transfer talks with Napoli over January return to Serie A

Napoli president Aurelio De Laurentiis has teased fans that the Italian giants could swoop for Zlatan Ibrahimovic in January.

Former Manchester United striker Ibrahimovic faces his first MLS play-off game this week as his LA Galaxy side face a tough trip to face Minnesota United.

Ibrahimovic has scored 30 goals in the MLS this season, but his side would be dumped out of this year's competition if they lose to Minnesota - and the 38-year-old's contract expires in December.

The legendary Swede recently admitted he would consider a return to Serie A - where he has won the title with Juventus , Inter and AC Milan - and Napoli are among the teams leading the race to sign him.

(Image: USA TODAY Sports)

"He is a friend," De Laurentiis told TV Luna regarding Ibrahimovic ahead of the Champions League clash with Salzburg.

"I met him, not as a footballer, but as a normal person in Los Angeles because we shared the same hotel. I invited him to dinner with his wife and children and we had a great night.

"On the pitch, he seems like one type of person, but really he is completely different. My desire would be to see in our jersey.

"It's more than just a suggestion, but it's up to him. It has been spoken about for a few months."

(Image: Getty Images)

De Laurentiis's comments Napoli boss Carlo Ancelotti said he would be interested in talking to Ibrahimovic over a potential move.

"Ibrahimovic? I will call him tonight and tell him that we are waiting for him here," said the former Chelsea boss following Napoli's win against Verona last Saturday.

"I follow him a lot. In 29 games in the MLS he scored 30 goals."
description: The legendary Swede recently admitted he would consider a return to Serie A - and Napoli are interested
